TopicTitle: [1.9.x] All Y'All Continued - One-Button Common Action Grouping

Articles.Content:
27 minutes ago, Xtra said:

@linuxgurugamer  Hello again... 

I'm sure you're tired of hearing from me and I do apologize, but you make Great mods and I'm just trying to use them without having my log filled with errors.  Yes some errors can be ignored (although they shouldn't - they're there for a reason),  but according to my log count, I have 151 log errors just for AYA_AntennaRT not being found. 

Any idea what I'm missing to cause these?

I do see where I have 149 entries where it applied, so I believe the mod is working... just not sure if it's working completely as intended or if I'm missing an additional mod.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jNQlvjgdalUu1PMpkKwaFqmUPLtbCRkp/view?usp=share_link

 

Interesting.  Never reported until now.

Try deleting the file:   

GameData\AllYAll\ModuleManager\AllYAll_Modsupport.cfg

and try again.  This was added several years ago, and there was never a module specific to RT, so I don't know if it will work or not, please let me know

Does this mod conflict with the Default Action Groups mod? I'm trying to have an IVA only playthrough and I love your mod, but I need some default custom action groups to fly a probe from Mission Control in the early game.

New release, 0.11.21

  • Performance improvement in RCS module, moved calculations into VesselModule
  • Prevented calcs being done on any vessels other than the active vessel

The code for the new feature which was requested  created a performance bottleneck when a vessel had lots of RCS modules.  This fixes that

After installing this mod, i have stuttering for 2-3 seconds (game freezes). As long as i stage the SRB's, stturering goes away. I've been searching for 3 days cause i got many mods, do i really don't know if its incompatibility with any other mod. I didn't try on a fresh install

This is my first ever post, and I did it because I used to love this mod. 

I can confirm the previous post is accurate, and I did extensive testing to verify that this mod is creating a game breaking stutter/memory leak that leads to crashes and overall unplayability.

I looked through the logs and crash files, this mod was not mentioned at all in them, but removing this mod fixed the issue.

Basically, the mod causes shuddering based on part count. But the part count did not need to be high. 
I have a large number of mods including kerbalism ,so I know it is another mod interacting with this one, but only after removing this one did the problems end.

 

It may be related to the recent RCS changes, as crafts that did not have any rcs seemed to be unaffected.

As I said, a log file would not help in this situation. I personally checked the logs of multiple crashes, and they did not mention All Yall past the loading of the mod. However it was 100% this mod that was causing the issues. The crashes were caused by memory leaks leading to an access violation and Unity crash.
@linuxgurugamer just to let you know

I have recently experienced an extreme amount of lag when separating stages. I had no clue what was causing the problem, but stumbled across this. 
After removing All Y'All i no longer experience the lag.

The main KSP.Log did not readily reveal this to me, so i don't know if there are other logs needed.
Let me know which logs to upload and i will put them in the webz.

Came here after several hours of troubleshooting, seeing that others have apparently encountered the same issues as me with this mod.

It seems to be an arcane combination of factors. From what I can tell, it only seems to happen with *certain* crewed parts and *only* if the part count is also above 50 or so. For example, the Mk1-3 command pod causes lags, but not the Mk3 cockpit or the Mk1 Lander Can, when tested on the same 56 part rocket.

Always post your logs, people, even if you "didn't see anything" in your analysis.  Mod maintainers and developers generally have a pretty keen eye, especially in their own work.  Logs help to identify mod conflicts and out-dated mod versions.

Furthermore, if you have tons of mods, duplicate your install then uninstall several mods at a time (up to 50% of installed mods) to see if you can replicate the errors under the new configuration.  If yes, keep removing.  If not, return the most recently removed mods a couple at a time until you can reproduce the problem.  You'll eventually discover a tipping point and can then add useful information to the diagnosis.  You may have already done this and, if so, add that to your problem description.

I think LGG prefers the player.log, but I could be wrong.  Nothing amiss in posting links to both and let him decide.  Remember those links should be related to a minimal KSP run that experiences your issue.  Screen capture video would also be very helpful if you're encountering lag.

I probably should have articulated a little more clearly.

Removing above Mentioned mod Fixed my problem. I discovered the issue on another thread and have since overwritten associated logs.

If needed, I will reproduce the issue on one of the clean installs I keep handy. Should this be the case, let me know which logs you want and I will reproduce the situation and upload the into the inter webz.

All of you who have had recent problems, you need to provide log files (Player.log) and the craft file, otherwise I can't do anything
